thread.title: Md. Teacher Wanted for Child Sex Abuse Turns Himself In
thread.title_full: Md. Teacher Wanted for Child Sex Abuse Turns Himself In

author: CBS Baltimore
title: Md. Teacher Wanted for Child Sex Abuse Turns Himself In
text:
Md. Teacher Wanted for Child Sex Abuse Turns Himself In February 1, 2017 5:24 PM Filed Under: Child Sex Abuse , Our Lady of Mt. Carmel 
BALTIMORE (WJZ)â€“ A Our Lady of Mount Carmel teacher and coach wanted for charges of sex abuse, has turned himself in Wednesday, according to Baltimore County Police. 
A warrant was issued Monday for Robert Bonner, who was also a part time assistant athletic director at the Catholic elementary and high school in Middle River, for charges of sex abuse of a minor, second degree assault and two counts of fourth degree sex offense. 
The incident that led to his arrest occurred on Jan. 20 and involved a student from the high school. 
Bonner worked at the school from 1992-1999 and then from 2011-2017. He was suspended Jan. 23 when police gave the school permission to do so.
